message_1: A sample of 200g of a radioactive substance has a half-life of 10 days. What is the amount of substance remaining after 30 days?
message_2:
To determine the amount of substance remaining after 30 days, we can use the formula for radioactive decay:

Final amount = Initial amount * (1/2)^(time elapsed / half-life)

In this case, the initial amount is 200g, the half-life is 10 days, and the time elapsed is 30 days. Plugging these values into the formula, we get:

Final amount = 200g * (1/2)^(30 / 10)

Final amount = 200g * (1/2)^3

Final amount = 200g * (1/8)

Final amount = 25g

So, after 30 days, there will be 25g of the radioactive substance remaining.
